xxl.core.util.reflect

Class TestFramework

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.util.reflect.TestFramework

  • public class TestFramework
extends Object
    This framework allows it to write applications which are easily parameterizable via command line options. Additionally, automatic testing of such applications is easily possible. The results of test runs are returned as a MetaDataCursor with relational meta data (ResultSetMetaData).

    To support this TestFramework, a test class do not have to support many things. First: all public static fields which are not final, can be set via this framework (see method processParameters). For each field, the test class can also support a description, which has to be inside a public static String field with the name of the field plus "Description". The class can also offer a range of valid parameters (a field of the same type postfix "Min", resp. "Max").

    A compatible test class should call processParameters as first instruction inside the main method.

    For automatic testing, the test class can put measurements into the static list of the TestFramework class. If the class provides relational meta data for these measurements, then the automatic testing returns a MetaDataCursor, else it returns a normal Cursor which contains a list. To provide meta data, the test class has to offer a method public static ResultSetMetaData getReturnRSMD(). To build the meta data, the classes from xxl.core.relational.metaData are extremely useful.

    To get good input parameters for the tests, the test class can provide a method public static Iterator getTestValues(String fieldName) This method has to return an Iterator of valid test values for the given fieldName. If null is returned, then the automatic test environment generates values:

    • For int and double fields: generate values between fieldNameMin and fieldNameMax
    • For boolean fields: true and false (if in mode testAllBooleanCombinations, else only the default value is tested).
    If no values can be generated, then only the single default value is used for testing.

    • Field Detail

      • list

        public static List list
        This list can be used by applications to hand over some measurements to the testClass method. Use list.add to do this.

      • shuffleCursorFunction

        public static Function shuffleCursorFunction
        Function which gets a Cursor and returns a Cursor where the Objects are randomly permutated. This Function can be used to parameterize the method testClass below.

      • reverseCursorFunction

        public static Function reverseCursorFunction
        Function which gets a Cursor and returns a Cursor where the order of the Objects is inverse. This Function can be used to parameterize the method testClass below.

    • Method Detail

      • mapToArgString

        public static String mapToArgString(Map map)
        Writes the entries of a map into a String. Each map entry (key,value) is converted into key=value.
        Parameters:
        map - Map containing command line options
        Returns:
        a String representation of the map.

      • argStringArrayToMap

        public static Map argStringArrayToMap(String[] args,
                                      Class cl)
        Writes the parameters given by args (key=value) into a map. To do this, there is a type conversion needed. Therefore, each key value has to be a field inside a given class cl. The type of this field is used for the conversion.
        Parameters:
        args - String array containing key=value Strings.
        cl - Class used for type conversion.
        Returns:
        Map containing (key,value) pairs (values have the correct type).

      • processParameters

        public static boolean processParameters(String description,
                                        Class cl,
                                        String[] args,
                                        PrintStream ps)
        Processes the parameters given by the args array and writes the values into public static variables of class cl. If a PrintStream is given, then the current parameterset is sent to this PrintStream. If something like "help" is given as first parameter, then all possible parameters of a class are printed on a help screen. Then, the given description is outputed first.
        Parameters:
        description - Textual description of the class
        cl - Class which needs the parameters.
        args - Given parameterset.
        ps - PrintStream for output of current parameterset.
        Returns:
        true, if the calling programm should proceed. false if the help screen was shown and processing further may not be the right choice.

      • testClass

        public static Cursor testClass(Class cl,
                               MetaDataCursor inputParamCursor,
                               String testName)
        Runs a series of tests of the class cl.
        Parameters:
        cl - Class to be tested.
        inputParamCursor - Input parameters for the tests.
        testName - Name of the test.
        Returns:
        Cursor or MetaDataCursor containing the results of the tests. There are a lot of useful columns inside the result.

      • testClass

        public static Cursor testClass(Class cl,
                               int startTestNumber,
                               int endTestNumber,
                               String testName,
                               boolean testAllBooleanCombinations,
                               Function generateFiltersFunction,
                               Function getWrapperCursor,
                               Predicate filterPredicate,
                               Predicate varyParameterWithName)
        Runs automatic tests for class cl using automatically generated input parameters. It is possible to perform only some tests, not all.
        Parameters:
        cl - Class to be tested.
        startTestNumber - First test number (usually 1)
        endTestNumber - Last test number (or -1 if all tests should be performed).
        testName - Name of the test (also returned inside the Cursor).
        testAllBooleanCombinations - If true, all public static boolean (not final) fields are tested with true and false. If false, only the default value is used for testing.
        generateFiltersFunction - If this function is not null, then the Function gets the fieldName and a Cursor which contains all values that will be tested. The Function has to return a Cursor, which contains the values that will really be tested. For example, the Function have a Filter inside.
        filterPredicate - If this predicate is not null, then the Predicate is used as a filter for the input data cursor. The predicate gets an input tuple and has to return true iff the tuple really should be used as input.
        getWrapperCursor - If this function is not null, then the Function is called with the Cursor which contains all combination of values that will be tested. The Function has to return a Cursor again which then is really used. The main purpose for this Function is to reorder the tests, so that the tests can be repeated in different orders. The input Cursor itself contains Object arrays.
        varyParameterWithName - Determines if a parameter is varied at all. If the predicate called with a parameter name returns false, then this parameter is not varied.
        Returns:
        Cursor or MetaDataCursor containing the results of the tests. There are a lot of useful additional columns inside the result.

      • constructInputMetaDataCursor

        public static MetaDataCursor constructInputMetaDataCursor(Class cl,
                                                          boolean testAllBooleanCombinations,
                                                          Function generateFiltersFunction,
                                                          Function getWrapperCursor,
                                                          Predicate varyParameterWithName)
        Constructs input data for a test of class cl. All combination of allowed values are used and the cartesian product of them is computed.
        Parameters:
        cl - Class to be tested.
        testAllBooleanCombinations - If true, all public static boolean (not final) fields are tested with true and false. If false, only the default value is used for testing.
        generateFiltersFunction - If this function is not null, then the Function gets the fieldName and a Cursor which contains all values that will be tested. The Function has to return a Cursor, which contains the values that will really be tested. For example, the Function have a Filter inside.
        getWrapperCursor - If this function is not null, then the Function is called with the Cursor which contains all combination of values that will be tested. The Function has to return a Cursor again which then is really used. The main purpose for this Function is to reorder the tests, so that the tests can be repeated in different orders. The input Cursor itself contains Object arrays.
        varyParameterWithName - Determines if a parameter is varied at all. If the predicate called with a parameter name returns false, then this parameter is not varied.
        Returns:
        MetaDataCursor with test parameters.

      • countTestCasesForClass

        public static int countTestCasesForClass(Class cl,
                                         boolean testAllBooleanCombinations,
                                         Function generateFiltersFunction,
                                         Predicate varyParameterWithName)
        Returns the number of tests which are automatically generated.
        Parameters:
        cl - Class to be tested.
        testAllBooleanCombinations - If true, all public static boolean (not final) fields are tested with true and false. If false, only the default value is used for testing.
        generateFiltersFunction - If this function is not null, then the Function gets the fieldName and a Cursor which contains all values that will be tested. The Function has to return a Cursor, which contains the values that will really be tested. For example, the Function have a Filter inside.
        varyParameterWithName - Determines if a parameter is varied at all. If the predicate called with a parameter name returns false, then this parameter is not varied.
        Returns:
        the number of tests.

      • countTestCasesForClass

        public static int countTestCasesForClass(Class cl,
                                         boolean testAllBooleanCombinations,
                                         Predicate varyParameterWithName)
        Returns the number of tests which are automatically generated.
        Parameters:

        varyParameterWithName - Determines if a parameter is varied at all. If the predicate called with a parameter name returns false, then this parameter is not varied.
        Returns:
        the number of tests.
